title: News Anchor Fired Over Starbucks Cup: Political Controversy and Backlash - World Today News
text: Turkish news anchor Meltem Günay was fired on Sunday 24 December after bringing a clearly visible Starbucks cup with him on air. This is reported by the channel itself on Twitter/X, relayed by several international media such as The Independent . The coffee cup is to blame Günay worked as a news anchor at the Turkish, pro-Erdogan television channel TGRT. Several viewers are said to have reacted to the Starbucks cup standing in front of the news anchor on last Sunday’s broadcast. Many consider Starbucks to be pro-Israel, and the coffee cup was thus perceived as a political stance from Günay. Several famous faces have seriously made Snapchat an important platform to show off in recent times. It has also become a solid source of income for Isabel Raad, who for the first time reveals to her followers exactly how much she earns daily. view more In a statement from the TV channel they write that both the news anchor and the producer of the broadcast were fired as a result of inappropriate product placement. – In line with the institution’s principles, it is strictly forbidden for the anchor to promote any company, the statement says. Rage after this: – Disrespectful TGRT further writes that they recognize the Turkish people’s support for Gaza, and that they condemn the actions of the news anchor and the producer. It’s boiling around Starbucks According to the news agency Reuters a boycott campaign is spreading among Arab countries against Western brands and chains, such as Starbucks and McDonald’s. It is happening in the wake of the war between Hamas and Israel, which flared up again in October.
